Mercury Cadmium Telluride.name: Mercury Cadmium Telluride
Mercury Cadmium Telluride.description: Mercury Cadmium Telluride (HgCdTe or MCT) is a II-VI semiconductor alloy where the bandgap, and thus the optical/electrical properties, are precisely tuned by adjusting the Cadmium mole fraction (x). Values typically range from x=0 (HgTe, semimetal) to x=1 (CdTe, ~1.5eV bandgap). It is widely used in high-performance infrared sensors and thermal imaging systems, especially those requiring cryogenic cooling. The preferred substrate for highest quality epitaxial growth is often lattice-matched Cadmium Zinc Telluride (CdZnTe or CZT) with approximately 4% Zn concentration.

safety.toxicity: High. Contains Mercury (neurotoxin, heavy metal) and Cadmium (carcinogen). Elemental Tellurium is also toxic.
safety.handling: Requires specialized handling under strict protocols: Use appropriate PPE (nitrile gloves, safety glasses, respirator if generating dust/fumes), work only in certified fume hoods or glove boxes. Follow designated hazardous waste disposal procedures.

lattice_constant.value: ~6.461 Å (for x=0, HgTe) to ~6.481 Å (for x=1, CdTe)
lattice_constant.notes: Varies nearly linearly with x (Vegard's Law applies approximately).

growth_fabrication.preferred_substrate: Cadmium Zinc Telluride (CdZnTe, often with ~4% Zn) for lattice matching. Si, GaAs, Sapphire also used with buffer layers.
growth_fabrication.crystal_orientations: (111)B [Te-face] often preferred for LPE; (211)B and (100) common for MBE/MOCVD depending on application and growth dynamics.
growth_fabrication.fabrication_compounds: High-purity elemental sources: Mercury (Hg, often 6N-7N+), Cadmium (Cd, 6N-7N+), Tellurium (Te, 6N-7N+). CdTe compound source also used.
growth_fabrication.purity_requirements: Extremely high purity (typically 99.9999% [6N] or better) is critical to minimize unintentional doping and defects affecting carrier lifetime and noise.

band_gap.notes: Tunable via Cadmium fraction (x). Commonly targeted: x≈0.2 for LWIR (~0.1 eV), x≈0.3 for MWIR (~0.25 eV).

bandgap_equation.hansen_eg: Eg(x, T) ≈ -0.302 + 1.93x + 5.35e-4 * T*(1-2x) - 0.810*x^2 + 0.832*x^3 (eV). Empirical, various forms exist.

electrical_properties.common_dopants: n-type: Indium (In), typically 10¹⁴-10¹⁶ cm⁻³. p-type: Arsenic (As), Gold (Au), or Hg vacancies, typically 10¹⁵-10¹⁷ cm⁻³.

carrier_concentration.value: Intrinsic (ni) ~10¹⁶ cm⁻³ at 300K (x=0.2), ~10¹³ cm⁻³ at 77K. Extrinsic control via doping.

electron_mobility.notes: Very high at 77 K for low x (e.g., x=0.2), decreases with higher x and higher temperature.

hole_mobility.notes: Significantly lower than electron mobility, also temp/composition dependent (77 K values).

dielectric_constant.notes: Static value, varies slightly with x and frequency.

resistivity.notes: Depends strongly on composition, temperature, and doping level/type.

breakdown_field.notes: Limits high-field device operation, sensitive to defects.

optical_properties.spectral_range: SWIR, MWIR, LWIR (0.8 µm to >30 µm)

refractive_index.notes: High index, varies with wavelength and composition (x).

absorption_coefficient.notes: Very high near the band edge for efficient photon absorption.

quantum_efficiency.notes: Internal QE can be very high in good material with appropriate AR coating.

responsivity.notes: Typical values at 77 K, depends on wavelength, bias, device type.

operating_temperature.notes: Required for optimal S/N ratio, especially for LWIR detection, by reducing thermally generated carriers (dark current).

thermal_conductivity.notes: Poor thermal conductor compared to Si or GaAs.

specific_heat.notes: At room temperature, varies with x.

density.notes: Increases significantly with higher Hg content.

chemical_properties.oxidation: Readily oxidizes in air, especially at elevated temperatures. Surface passivation is essential.
chemical_properties.etchability: Wet etches using Br-Methanol, Br-Ethylene Glycol, or various acid mixtures (e.g., lactic/nitric/hydrofluoric). Dry etching (ICP, RIE) also used.
chemical_properties.stability: Chemically unstable without passivation. Sensitive to acids and some organic solvents.
